A careless admin leaked half his RSA private key while encrypting a secret message. Can you recover the original message from the ciphertext? Here it is: 5231157152933067937281123391377332849141285938402377311950738121274948445023545267749076064724564550425323500144422102140046895435880168527396228454592463

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7755329724960719778510281693778830031824495654727874808341112642895005571611018330748568293402937269183873336116171408314676262402865967831670309397337749, e=1375420146386170217675174335922591337717253129222984795092688061738271170067733717838802217700063867061823966826523761650041221125818917327096979555200269, partial_p=16619157352357993389

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{j1bk7xxt}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5231157152933067937281123391377332849141285938402377311950738121274948445023545267749076064724564550425323500144422102140046895435880168527396228454592463
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7755329724960719778510281693778830031824495654727874808341112642895005571611018330748568293402937269183873336116171408314676262402865967831670309397337749, e=1375420146386170217675174335922591337717253129222984795092688061738271170067733717838802217700063867061823966826523761650041221125818917327096979555200269, partial_p=16619157352357993389
extra_info: p=104320141457150675108458000499169154215339811214658536195952243179910454547231, q=74341633519987207706923620566939914465488875666564541629814333905358411461579, Ï†(n)=7755329724960719778510281693778830031824495654727874808341112642895005571610839668973591155520121887562807227047490579627795039325040201254585040531328940
